COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT THIS COMMON FACILITIES AGREEMENT (as amended, amended and restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time, this Agreement ) is entered into as of September 25, 2013 (the Effective Date ), by and between Broken Bow Wind, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ( Broken Bow ), and Broken Bow Wind II, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company ( Broken Bow II ). Broken Bow and Broken Bow II may be referred to herein individually as a Party and collectively as the Parties. RECITALS WHEREAS, Broken Bow owns an approximately eighty (80) MW wind-powered electric generating facility located in Custer County, Nebraska (the Broken Bow Project ); WHEREAS, Broken Bow II is developing an approximately seventy-five (75) MW wind energy electric generating facility to be located in Custer County, Nebraska (the Broken Bow II Project ); and WHEREAS, on the terms and conditions set forth herein, Broken Bow desires to grant certain easement rights to Broken Bow II and the Parties desire to share in the use and ownership of certain personal property, equipment and facilities associated with the Broken Bow Project collector sub-station interconnecting the Broken Bow Project to the electric transmission system, which are set forth on Annex 1 hereto (collectively, the Common Interconnection Facilities ). NOW THEREFORE, in consideration of the premises and of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties hereby agree as follows: AGREEMENT DEFINITIONS. For purposes of this Agreement, in addition to other capitalized terms defined elsewhere herein, the following terms shall have the indicated meanings: Agreement is defined in the Preamble of this Agreement. Ancillary Equipment means the personal property, including equipment, tools, spare parts and fixtures, utilized by the Operator from time to time to support the Common Interconnection Facilities under this Agreement. Broken Bow is defined in the Preamble of this Agreement. Broken Bow Administrative Agent means KeyBank National Association, as the administrative agent for the lenders under the Broken Bow Financing Agreement, and its successors and assigns. Broken Bow Financing Agreement means that certain Financing Agreement, dated as of March 30, 2012, as amended by that certain Amendment No. 1 to Financing Agreement, dated as of December 31, 2012 and as further amended by that certain Amendment No. 2 to Financing Agreement, dated as of January 18, 2013 by and among Broken Bow, Broken Bow Administrative Agent and the other parties thereto, as may be further amended, amended and restated, supplemented or otherwise modified from time to time. Broken Bow Indemnified Parties is defined in Section 3.6 below. Broken Bow Project is defined in the Recitals of this Agreement. Broken Bow Substation means personal property, fixtures, equipment and facilities associated with the collector sub-station that is part of the Broken Bow Project. Broken Bow II is defined in the Preamble of this Agreement. Broken Bow II Connection Date means the date on which the Broken Bow II Project is first physically connected to the Common Interconnection Facilities. Broken Bow II Indemnified Parties is defined in Section 3.6 below. Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities is defined in Section 3.1(a) below. Broken Bow II Maintenance Services is defined in Section 4.1(a) below. Broken Bow II Parties is defined in Section 2.2 below. Broken Bow II Project is defined in the Recitals of this Agreement. Broken Bow II Substation means personal property, fixtures, equipment and facilities associated with the collector sub-station that is part of the Broken Bow II Project to be installed on the Interconnection Facilities Easement Area (as defined in the Substation Easement). Commercial Operation Date means that date on which all of the turbines forming part of the Broken Bow II Project shall have been constructed, tested and interconnected with the electric transmission system, and all of the facilities forming part of the Broken Bow II Project are staffed and operational and capable of providing power to the electric transmission system, as such Commercial Operation Date shall be identified in a written notice provided by Broken Bow II to Broken Bow. Common Interconnection Facilities is defined in the Recitals of this Agreement. Common Interconnection Facilities Easement is defined in Section 2.2 below. Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area is defined in Section 2.2 below. Construction Security shall have the meaning set forth in the Substation Easement. Contractor is defined in Section 3.1(b) below. Design Proposal is defined in Section 3.1(a) below. Discharge Date is defined in Section 3.1(a) below. Effective Date is defined in the Preamble of this Agreement. EPC Services is defined in Section 3.2(b) below. FERC is defined in Section 8.1 below. Financing is defined in Section 10.8(a) below. FPA is defined in Section 8.1 below. Governmental Authority means any court, tribunal, authority, agency, commission, official or other instrumentality, including regulatory authorities and bodies, of the United States or any state, county, city or other political subdivision, any quasi-governmental regulatory authority, such as NERC or SPP, acting under delegated authority, or any judicial tribunal of competent jurisdiction. Initiation Notice is defined in Section 3.1(b) below. Interest Rate is defined in Section 9.1 below. Laws means any applicable constitutional provisions, statutes, acts, codes, laws, rules, regulations, ordinances, orders, decrees, rulings, judgments or decisions of a Governmental Authority. Losses is defined in Section 3.6 below. NERC means the North America Electric Reliability Corporation and each applicable regional reliability entity designated by NERC and their respective successors. O&M Budget is defined in Section C3 of Exhibit C. O&M Costs means all costs incurred from time to time in connection with the use, operation, inspection, maintenance, repair, alteration, relocation, improvement and replacement of the Common Interconnection Facilities, the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area and the Ancillary Equipment, whether such costs are incurred pursuant to contractual arrangements with the Operator or its subcontractors or otherwise. O&M Costs include both (a) direct costs of the Common Interconnection Facilities, the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area and the Ancillary Equipment, including, but not limited to, the costs of labor, parts, property tax and insurance, and (b) indirect costs, including, but not limited to, overhead and mark-up that may be charged by the Operator or its subcontractors, to the extent fairly allocable to the performance by the Operator of its obligations under this Agreement; provided, however, if a Party or its affiliate is acting in the role of the Operator, any mark-up included as an O&M Cost shall be limited to fifteen percent (15%), and in no event shall any mark-up be applied to labor, property tax or insurance costs. For the avoidance of doubt, O&M Costs shall include both capital expenditures and operating costs. Operator means the entity that is then currently responsible for operating the Common Interconnection Facilities pursuant to this Agreement, including any Replacement Operator. The initial Operator shall be Broken Bow or one or more of its designated affiliates. Operator Default is defined in Section 4.4(a) below. Operator Replacement Notice is defined in Section 4.4(b) below. Party and Parties are defined in the Preamble of this Agreement. Percentage Interest means for each Party, at any time the quotient (expressed as a percentage) of the nameplate capacity of such Party s Project divided by the total nameplate capacity of both Projects at the applicable time; provided, that before the Broken Bow II Connection Date, Broken Bow II s Percentage Interest shall be zero. Person means any natural person, corporation, limited liability company, partnership, firm, association, Governmental Authority or any other entity whether acting in an individual, fiduciary or other capacity. Project means the Broken Bow Project or the Broken Bow II Project, as applicable. Projects means both the Broken Bow Project and the Broken Bow II Project. Project Lenders is defined in Section 10.8(a) below. Property means certain property which is owned by Broken Bow and located in Custer County, Nebraska as more particularly described in Exhibit B attached hereto and made part hereof. Prudent Wind Industry Practices means any of the practices, methods, equipment, specifications, and standards of care, skill, safety and diligence, as the same may change from time to time, but applied in light of the facts known at the time, as are generally applied or utilized under comparable circumstances by reasonably experienced and prudent professionals in respect of the design, development, construction, commissioning, maintenance, financing and operation of wind generating facilities located in the Unites States of America of comparable type and complexity to the Projects. Prudent Wind Industry Practices does not necessarily mean the best practice, method, or standard of care, skill, safety and diligence in all cases, but is instead intended to encompass a range of acceptable practices, methods, and standards. Replacement Operator is defined in Section 4.4(b) below. Services is defined in Section C1 of Exhibit C. SPP means Southwest Power Pool, Inc. an Arkansas corporation. Substation Easement means that certain Grant of Easements and Easement Agreement for Interconnection and Transmission Facilities, dated as of the Effective Date, between Broken Bow, as grantor, and Broken Bow II, as grantee. Term is defined in Article 6 below. Undivided Interest is defined in Section 2.1 below. GRANT OF RIGHTS. Common Interconnection Facilities. Subject to any required regulatory approvals and acceptances, and upon and subject to the terms, conditions, restrictions and reservations set forth in this Agreement, Broken Bow hereby GRANTS, SELLS, TRANSFERS, ASSIGNS, AND CONVEYS, as of the Broken Bow II Connection Date, an undivided ownership interest in and to the Common Interconnection Facilities equal to the Broken Bow II Percentage Interest, AS IS, WITH ALL FAULTS AND WITHOUT WARRANTY, SPECIFICALLY INCLUDING WITHOUT WARRANTY OF TITLE, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, WITHOUT ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR OTHER WARRANTIES ARISING BY COMMON LAW, while at the same time reserving to itself an undivided ownership interest in and to such Common Interconnection Facilities equal to the Broken Bow Percentage Interest; provided, in any case, that each Party will own an individual interest in the Common Interconnection Facilities, jointly, as tenants-in-common, equal to and in accordance with its Percentage Interest, for the joint use of the Common Interconnection Facilities (the undivided interest of each such Party so owned in the Common Interconnection Facilities is referred to in this Agreement as the Party s Undivided Interest ). Each Party will have the right to own, hold, and use such Party s Undivided Interest in the Common Interconnection Facilities in accordance with the terms of this Agreement. Broken Bow hereby represents and warrants that it has valid title to the Common Interconnection Facilities and has, and will have as of the Broken Bow II Connection Date, the right to convey Broken Bow II s Undivided Interest to Broken Bow II in the manner and at the time set forth in this Section 2.1. Common Interconnection Facilities Easement. For good and valuable consideration, the legal sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged by Broken Bow, Broken Bow hereby grants to Broken Bow II and its licensees, agents, representatives, employees, contractors, invitees, successors and assigns (the Broken Bow II Parties ), a non-exclusive easement (the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement ) which easement shall be appurtenant to and for the benefit of the Broken Bow II Project on, along, under and across the real property more particularly described in the attached Exhibit A (the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area ), for the right to, in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, (a) construct, install, inspect, patrol, operate, use, maintain, repair, upgrade, alter and remove the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities and (b) inspect, patrol, operate, use, maintain and repair Broken Bow II s Undivided Interest in and to the Common Interconnection Facilities. Broken Bow II Parties shall have all of the rights and benefits necessary and convenient for the full enjoyment and use of the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement, including, to the extent consistent with such rights and benefits, the right, permission and authority to cross the Property for purposes of access to the Common Interconnection Facilities, including ingress to and egress from the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area. If any portion of the Common Facilities Easement Area is fenced at any time during the Term of this Agreement in a manner that prevents access by Broken Bow II to the Common Interconnection Facilities, Broken Bow will furnish Broken Bow II with a copy of all keys or other ability to open and close gates 24 hours/7 days per week. No Fixtures. Broken Bow acknowledges and agrees (a) that Broken Bow II is the legal and beneficial owner and operator of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities and as of the Broken Bow II Connection Date, Broken Bow II s own Undivided Interest in the Common Interconnection Facilities, and (b) that the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities and such Undivided Interest constitute and shall remain personal property as defined under Article 9 of the Uniform Commercial Code of Nebraska and not a part of, an accession or addition to, or a fixture on the real property owned by Broken Bow, notwithstanding the manner in which the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities or Common Interconnection Facilities are or may be affixed to the real property owned by Broken Bow. Broken Bow shall have no right, title or interest in the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities or Broken Bow II s Undivided Interest in the Common Interconnection Facilities, notwithstanding that the foregoing may be physically mounted or adhered to the real property owned by Broken Bow or improvements to the real property owned by Broken Bow. Broken Bow shall, at Broken Bow II s sole cost and expense, (a) confirm, from time to time during the Term, such acknowledgement and agreement upon written request of Broken Bow II or its Project Lenders, (b) request from Broken Bow s Project Lenders such an acknowledgement regarding the foregoing and (c) authorize Broken Bow II to file any precautionary UCC-1 financing statement or fixture filing confirming same subject to the review and approval by Broken Bow and its Project Lenders of such UCC-1 financing statement or fixture filing, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed. Limitations. Except as set forth in Section 2.1, Broken Bow disclaims any warranties, express or implied, as to the adequacy of the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area or the Common Interconnection Facilities for purposes of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Broken Bow reserves the right to use the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area and the Ancillary Equipment for any purpose not inconsistent with Broken Bow II s rights hereunder. CONSTRUCTION. Initiation Notice. Broken Bow II shall submit to Broken Bow a proposed design (including detailed engineering drawings, technical specifications and other technical and back-up documentation reasonably requested by Broken Bow) (the Design Proposal ) of all of the interconnection facilities that are necessary to connect the Broken Bow II Substation with the Common Interconnection Facilities, to be used by Broken Bow II exclusively for the Broken Bow II Project, which will be located within the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area (as defined below) (the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities ) at least ninety (90) days prior to the desired commencement of construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities for review and comment by Broken Bow; provided that, prior to the date that all of Broken Bow s obligations have been discharged and fulfilled and all of the commitments of Broken Bow s Project Lenders have terminated under the Broken Bow Financing Agreement (the Discharge Date ), Broken Bow II shall simultaneously deliver a copy of the Design Proposal to Broken Bow Administrative Agent at its address set forth in Section 10.15. Immediately following the occurrence of the Discharge Date, Broken Bow shall, jointly with the Broken Bow Administrative Agent, notify Grantee of such occurrence. Broken Bow shall have twenty (20) business days after receipt of the Design Proposal to provide a written notice to Broken Bow II either rejecting or approving Design Proposal, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed; provided, however, if Broken Bow fails to respond to the Design Proposal within twenty (20) business days after receipt thereof, then the Design Proposal shall be deemed approved by Broken Bow. If Broken Bow rejects the Design Proposal, then Broken Bow shall provide specific reasons for such rejection, and Broken Bow II will provide a revised version of the Design Proposal that addresses each of Broken Bow s objections. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Broken Bow s approval of the Design Proposal shall not constitute a waiver of Broken Bow s rights under any other provision of this Agreement. If and when Broken Bow II desires to exercise its rights under this Agreement to construct and install the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities, Broken Bow II shall provide a written notice to Broken Bow (an Initiation Notice ). Any Initiation Notice shall include: (i) the final design of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities as approved pursuant to Section 3.1(a), (ii) the names of one or more possible contractors that will be primarily responsible for the EPC Services, whether through use of subcontractors or otherwise (each a Contractor ), together with documentation reasonably necessary for Broken Bow to determine the qualifications of the proposed Contractors (unless such Contractor is listed on Exhibit E, in which case such documentation shall not be required), (iii) evidence of the insurance coverages required by Section 3.3, (iv) the final designed nameplate capacity of the Broken Bow II Project and (v) the approximate dates of commencement and duration of construction. An Initiation Notice must be provided at least forty-five (45) days prior to commencement of construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. The Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities shall be constructed in accordance with the final approved Design Proposal and shall be utilized by Broken Bow II solely for the Broken Bow II Project. Broken Bow II shall contract and be responsible for the design, engineering, procurement, permitting, construction and testing of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities (collectively, the EPC Services ). The EPC Services shall conform to and be performed in accordance with Prudent Wind Industry Practices. Broken Bow II shall only perform the EPC Services by and through Contractors that are approved by Broken Bow prior to performing any EPC Services. Broken Bow shall have ten (10) business days after receipt of the Initiation Notice or any other written notice requesting approval of a Contractor provided to Broken Bow by Broken Bow II (together with documentation reasonably necessary for Broken Bow to determine the qualifications of the proposed Contractors) to provide a written notice to Broken Bow II either rejecting or approving such Contractor; provided, however, if Broken Bow fails to deliver such written notice within such ten (10) business day period, the Contractors identified in the Initiation Notice or other written notice shall be deemed approved; provided further, that the Contractors listed on Exhibit E are hereby approved by Broken Bow; provided further that, Broken Bow II shall, prior to the Discharge Date, simultaneously deliver a copy of the Initiation Notice or such other written notice requesting approval of a Contractor to Broken Bow Administrative Agent at its address set forth in Section 10.15. Broken Bow II shall not engage any Contractors that are rejected by Broken Bow in the performance of the EPC Services in accordance with the preceding sentence. Broken Bow shall have the right to inspect the performance and/or resultant work of the EPC Services. Broken Bow shall have the right to direct Broken Bow II and Broken Bow II s contractors and/or their subcontractors to cease performance of the EPC Services, if the activities or services of such contractors and/or subcontractors (i) are inconsistent with Prudent Wind Industry Practices, (ii) have resulted in, or could be expected to result in, a breach of this Agreement, (iii) interfere with, impede or delay, or could be expected to interfere with, impede or delay, the operation or maintenance of the Broken Bow Project and such interference has not been consented to by Broken Bow; or (iv) pose a health or safety risk to any of Broken Bow s employees, representatives, agents, contractors, subcontractors or any other Person or property. Broken Bow II shall be responsible for (1) retaining, managing, supervising and paying all contractors and subcontractors performing the EPC Services and (2) the acts, omissions or defaults of such contractors and subcontractors and their agents, representatives and employees. Insurance. From and after the Effective Date, each Party shall provide the other Party and its Project Lenders with additional insured status on its General Liability Policy (One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence or claims first-made basis and Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) aggregate) plus Umbrella/Excess liability coverage of Twenty Million Dollars ($20,000,000), in a form reasonably acceptable to such other Party. The General Liability Policy shall include coverage for sudden and accidental pollution exposure or this coverage may be provided by a separate policy. The Umbrella/Excess liability coverage shall not contain an exclusion for punitive or exemplary damages where insurable under law and shall not include pollution exposure coverage. The providing Party shall maintain such insurance for so long as the other Party is potentially liable for the actions or inactions of the providing Party affecting the other Party s project or the Common Interconnection Facilities (whether through joint and several liability, guarantee arrangements, or otherwise). Such policies shall also include a separation of insureds clause or endorsement. Each Party can choose to self-insure all or a part of the required limits under this Section 3.3(a), but not to exceed a self-insurance limit of Five Million Dollars ($5,000,000), and provided, further, that any such self-insurance program shall be reasonably satisfactory to the other Party and its Project Lenders with a letter of self-insurance. Both the Broken Bow and Broken Bow II shall provide all-risk insurance coverage (i.e. Builder s All Risk during construction until the Commercial Operation Date for Broken Bow II and operational all-risk during operations for both Parties) for their respective specific assets, provided, however, that Broken Bow is responsible for insuring the Common Interconnection Facilities under its Builder s All Risk and all-risk policies. Both Parties shall endorse their respective Builders All-Risk and all risk policies to the effect that loss or damage to the Common Interconnection Facilities is considered as direct delay in start-up and/or business interruption coverage (as opposed to contingent business interruption). The policy limits for Builder s All Risk shall be sufficient to cover full construction costs, and the policy limits for all-risk shall be sufficient to cover probable maximum loss. Both Grantee and Grantor will be responsible for any deductible under its policy, except for the case of willful misconduct or negligence, in which case the offending Party will be responsible for the deductible up to One Hundred Thousand Dollars ($100,000). The insurance policies required by this Section 3.3 shall (i) be primary non-contributory and not excess to or contributing with any other insurance or self-insurance carried by the other Party; (ii) waive subrogation against the other Party and waive any right of the insurers to any setoff or counterclaim or any other deduction, whether by attachment or otherwise, in respect of any liability of the other Party; (iii) except as specifically set forth herein, be on a no coinsurance or self-insurance basis; and (iv) not require deductibles in excess of Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000) for all risks. The insurance policies required by this Section 3.3 shall contain a provision that coverages afforded under the policies will not be canceled or allowed to expire (or, if BP Wind Energy North America Inc. and Sempra Energy cease to be the direct or indirect owners of Broken Bow II or the limits under such policies are in any way reduced, including the erosion of aggregates) until at least thirty (30) days prior written notice (ten (10) days in the case of nonpayment of premium) has been given to the other Party, and shall also provide that in the event the providing Party fails to pay the premium, the other Party shall have the right (but not the obligation) to pay the premium and continue coverage. If any of the required insurance coverages contain aggregate limits applying to other operations of the providing Party, and such limits are diminished by any incident, occurrence, claim, settlement, or judgment against such insurance, the providing Party shall take immediate steps to restore such aggregate limits or shall provide other insurance protection to maintain the required aggregate limits. The insurance policies required of a providing Party by this Section 3.3 shall be placed with insurance carriers authorized to do business in the State of Nebraska and rated with (A) an AM Best Insurance rating of A- or better and a financial size category of VII or higher, or (B) a Standard & Poor s financial strength rating of A- or higher, or (C) other insurance companies of recognized responsibility satisfactory to the other Party. The insurance policies required of a providing Party by Section 3.3(b) shall name the other Party or its designee as loss payee with respect to the contractually required insurance under Section 3.3(b). Each providing Party s policy shall include an acceptable lender s loss payable endorsement such as 438 BFU or other acceptable equivalent wording (or, if the other Party has no Project Lenders, a multiple insured clause) which shall contain non-vitiation language which shall provide that in the event that the providing Party performs a vitiating act that might otherwise void coverage, the coverage will remain in full force and effect for the benefit of the other Party and its designated lenders and shall provide that any payment thereunder with respect to the required cover for any loss or damage with respect to the other Party shall be made to the other Party or its designee. All costs, premiums, expenses and/or fees associated with the insurance required pursuant to this Section 3.3 shall be for the providing Party s account and shall not be O&M Costs. Each Party shall, and shall cause each of its applicable affiliates to, use commercially reasonable efforts to assist the other Party in obtaining or renewing applicable insurance coverages and/or making, prosecuting and administrating any claim thereunder. Within thirty (30) days of a request by the providing Party, the other Party shall provide such information as may be required for the providing Party to obtain the placement or renewal of any insurance coverage referenced in this Section 3.3. The Operator shall have the power and authority to disconnect a Party s Project for such Party s failure to comply with the provisions of this Section 3.3, (i) if such failure is not cured within five (5) days following notice from the Operator, with respect to a failure to maintain the required insurance, or (ii) if such failure is not cured within thirty (30) days following notice from the Operator, with respect to a delay in providing required insurance certificates. In such event, the applicable Party s Project shall be reconnected when the specific default is cured in full. No Construction Interference. Broken Bow II shall engineer, procure and construct the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities in such a way as to minimize the requirement for outages of the Broken Bow Project. If the need for an outage of the Broken Bow Project is identified by Broken Bow II, Broken Bow II shall seek Broken Bow s consent (which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed) prior to undertaking the construction activities giving rise to the need for such outage and Broken Bow II shall compensate Broken Bow for any Losses incurred by Broken Bow as a result of any such outage. After the completion of any such outage of the Broken Bow Project, Broken Bow shall provide Broken Bow II with a written calculation of the Losses incurred by Broken Bow as a result of the outage, together with any documentation reasonably necessary for Broken Bow II to verify such costs, and Broken Bow II shall pay such amount Broken Bow within fifteen (15) days of receipt of such calculation. Neither Broken Bow II nor its affiliates shall, directly or indirectly, intentionally undertake any action in the ownership, development, engineering, procurement, construction, operation or maintenance of the Transmission Facilities (as defined in the Substation Easement) and/or the Interconnection Facilities (as defined in the Substation Easement) if such action will, or could reasonably be expected to adversely interfere with, impede or delay the operation or maintenance of the Broken Bow Project; provided, however, if Broken Bow II s actions or omissions during the ownership, development, engineering, procurement, construction, operation or maintenance of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities unintentionally interfere with, impede or delay the operation or maintenance of the Broken Bow Project in any manner, Broken Bow shall be entitled to exercise its rights under Sections 3.2(b) and 3.6 hereof, provided that such unintentional interference, impedance or delay shall not constitute a default hereunder, nor shall Broken Bow be entitled in such circumstance to terminate this Agreement as a result of such unintentional interference, impedance or delay. Location of Facilities and As-Built Survey. Broken Bow and Broken Bow II acknowledge that as of the Effective Date the proposed location of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities has not been finally determined by Broken Bow II and is subject to change based on the final design and construction of the Broken Bow II Project and the construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Broken Bow and Broken Bow II agree that, (a) prior to commencement of the construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities, Broken Bow and Broken Bow II shall agree to the final location of such facilities as identified in the final Design Proposal and (b) following the date that the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities are completed, tested and placed into commercial service, Broken Bow II shall undertake an as-built survey of the actual location of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Upon completion of such as-built survey, Broken Bow II shall provide a copy of such survey to Broken Bow. Indemnification. Broken Bow II shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Broken Bow and its affiliates and its and their trustees, beneficiaries, tenants, invitees, officers, shareholders, members, partners, directors, agents, contractors and employees (the Broken Bow Indemnified Parties ) from and against all demands, claims, actions or causes of action, assessments, losses, damages, liabilities, costs and expenses, including, without limitation, taxes, interest, penalties and reasonable attorneys fees and disbursements (generally, Losses ), asserted against, imposed upon or incurred by one or more Broken Bow Indemnified Parties, directly or indirectly, by reason of, resulting from or in connection with (i) the breach of this Agreement by Broken Bow II, (ii) the gross negligence or willful misconduct of Broken Bow II, its trustees, beneficiaries, tenants, invitees, officers, shareholders, members, partners, directors, agents, contractors and employees, or (iii) the construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities, except, in each case, to the extent such Losses are caused by a Broken Bow Indemnified Party. Broken Bow shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Broken Bow II and its affiliates and its and their trustees, beneficiaries, tenants, invitees, officers, shareholders, members, partners, directors, agents, contractors and employees (the Broken Bow II Indemnified Parties ) from and against all Losses asserted against, imposed upon or incurred by one or more Broken Bow II Indemnified Parties, directly or indirectly, by reason of, resulting from or in connection with (i) the breach of this Agreement by Broken Bow or (ii) the gross negligence or willful misconduct of Broken Bow, its officers, shareholders, members, partners, directors, agents, contractors and employees, except, in each case, to the extent such Losses are caused by a Broken Bow II Indemnified Party. For the avoidance of doubt, Losses include any loss of revenues and any loss of and the unavailability of, reduction or inability to claim, any tax benefit, including federal production tax credits on an after-tax basis, based on a thirty-five percent (35%) effective federal tax rate, by Broken Bow or Broken Bow II as a result of any breach of this Agreement by Broken Bow II or Broken Bow, as applicable, and outages of the Broken Bow Project caused by or related to the construction, operation or maintenance of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Payment and Performance Security. As security for Broken Bow II s obligations under this Article 3, prior to commencement of the construction of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities, Broken Bow II shall provide Broken Bow the Construction Security. The Construction Security shall remain in full force and effect until the occurrence of the Commercial Operation Date, unless Broken Bow has made claims against the Construction Security, in which case the Construction Security shall remain outstanding until all such claims of Broken Bow are resolved. Broken Bow shall have the right to draw under any one or all of any letters of credit constituting Construction Security to satisfy any payment obligation of Broken Bow II hereunder that is not timely paid by Broken Bow II when due; provided, that if two letters of credit are provided for the Construction Security, each for 50% of the total required Construction Security, then Broken Bow shall be required to draw on each such letter of credit proportionally. The Construction Security required by this Section 3.7 is not intended to be in addition to the security provided pursuant to Section 4.8 of the Substation Easement, it being the intent of the Parties that the provision by Broken Bow II of Construction Security under (and as defined in) Section 4.8 of the Substation Easement shall also satisfy the requirements of this Section 3.7. Completion. The Parties shall cooperate appropriately in order to allow the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities to be constructed, tested and placed into commercial operation as expeditiously and inexpensively as possible, consistent with Prudent Wind Industry Practices. By way of example, the timing and duration of any outages of the Broken Bow Project required in order to construct the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities shall be coordinated with Broken Bow in order to minimize the costs to Broken Bow thereof. Prior to the Broken Bow II Connection Date, the Parties and the Operator shall cooperate in good faith in the preparation of, and shall agree to, startup and shut-down operating procedures for the Projects to ensure the reliable and safe operation of the Projects and the Common Interconnection Facilities. OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE. Maintenance of Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Following the Broken Bow II Connection Date, Broken Bow II shall fund and be responsible for the inspection, maintenance, repair, relocation and replacement of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities. Broken Bow II shall conduct all such inspection, maintenance, repair, relocation and replacement services ( Broken Bow II Maintenance Services ) in accordance with the same standards used by the Operator in connection with the operation and maintenance of the Common Interconnection Facilities generally, and in any event not less than Prudent Wind Industry Practices. Broken Bow II shall only perform the Broken Bow II Maintenance Services by and through contractors and subcontractors that are qualified to perform such Maintenance Services. The Parties shall adopt a procedure whereby Broken Bow II can inform Broken Bow immediately of any outage or potential outage discovered by Broken Bow II of the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities, so that Broken Bow can respond accordingly. Broken Bow shall have the right to inspect the performance and/or resultant work of the Broken Bow II Maintenance Services upon reasonable notice to Broken Bow II. Broken Bow shall have the right to direct Broken Bow II and, under more exigent circumstances which preclude communication with Broken Bow II, the contractors and/or subcontractors to cease performance of the Broken Bow II Maintenance Services if, in Broken Bow s reasonable judgment, any of the contractors or subcontractors (i) are not qualified to perform such services or (ii) are not performing such services in a manner consistent with Prudent Wind Industry Practices. Broken Bow II shall be responsible for (A) retaining, managing, supervising and paying all contractors and subcontractors performing such Broken Bow II Maintenance Services and (B) the acts, omissions or defaults of such contractors and subcontractors and their agents, representatives and employees. Broken Bow shall fund and be responsible for the inspection, maintenance, repair, relocation and replacement of the Broken Bow Substation. Broken Bow shall conduct all such inspection, maintenance, repair, relocation and replacement services in accordance with the same standards used by the Operator in connection with the Common Interconnection Facilities generally, and in any event not less than Prudent Wind Industry Practices. If Broken Bow II fails to perform its obligations under Section 4.1(a) in a timely manner under the circumstances and such failure is reasonably expected to adversely affect the Broken Bow Project or the Common Interconnection Facilities, then the Operator shall have the right (in addition to any other rights and remedies provided under this Agreement or by law), upon prior notice to Broken Bow II that is appropriate under the circumstances, which notice shall be no less than twenty-four (24) hours, to perform or cause to be performed the Broken Bow II Maintenance Services that Broken Bow II has failed to perform. The Broken Bow II Maintenance Services performed by Broken Bow pursuant to this Section 4.1(c) shall conform to and be performed in accordance with Prudent Wind Industry Practices and be consistent with the design and engineering of the Common Interconnection Facilities and Broken Bow shall have the right to cause Broken Bow II to re-perform any of the Broken Bow II Maintenance Services not initially performed in accordance with such requirements. Maintenance of Common Interconnection Facilities. The Operator shall (i) be provided a copy of this Agreement and (ii) fund (as O&M Costs) and be responsible for the inspection, maintenance, repair and replacement of the Common Interconnection Facilities and the maintenance of the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area, in each case, in accordance with this Agreement, including taking the actions in Exhibit C. The Operator shall cause the Common Interconnection Facilities to be operated and maintained in all material respects in accordance with all applicable Laws, Prudent Wind Industry Practices, and the terms and provisions of this Agreement. The Operator may procure the services of subcontractors, consultants, supplier or vendors that in the reasonable judgment of the Operator may be necessary for the Operator to perform its duties under this Agreement; provided, that the costs of procuring such services shall be directly passed through to the Parties as O&M Costs, without any additional mark-up by the Operator. The Operator shall pay all real and personal property taxes, general or special, levied against the Common Interconnection Facilities and Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area before delinquency and before any fine, interest or penalty will become due or be imposed for their non-payment, except that the Operator may withhold payment of any tax if a Party is contesting the payment of such tax in good faith by appropriate proceedings and such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Common Interconnection Facilities or the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area, including the posting of any bond that is required by applicable Law to avoid such sale, forfeiture or loss while the payment of such tax is being contested and notifies the Operator thereof in writing at least thirty (30) days before such payment is due or paid. If the Common Interconnection Facilities or the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area is assessed with any real or personal property owned by a Party, the Operator shall (i) fairly allocate those taxes between such Party-owned property and the Common Interconnection Facilities and/or the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area and (ii) if permitted by Law, have the Common Interconnection Facilities and/or Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area, as applicable, separately assessed. All such taxes and assessments paid by the Operator and allocated as provided above, if applicable, shall be treated as O&M Costs and invoiced to the Parties in accordance with Section 4.3. During the Term, the Operator shall, as an O&M Cost, procure and maintain the insurance policies and coverages described in Exhibit D hereto with respect to the Common Interconnection Facilities and the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area. The Operator may, in accordance with the following provisions, direct the Parties to interrupt or reduce deliveries of electrical power (i) when necessary in order to maintain, repair, replace, remove, investigate, inspect or test any part of the Common Interconnection Facilities, (ii) if the Operator determines, in its reasonable discretion, that interruption or reduction is necessary due to an emergency, or (iii) at the direction of a Governmental Authority. With respect to any interruption or reduction of deliveries of electrical power pursuant to clauses (i) or (ii), above, the Operator shall limit the length of any such interruption or curtailment to that time strictly necessary to correct the problem. Any interruption or curtailment made pursuant to clause (i) above, shall be made to the extent commercially reasonable during periods of low or no winds or low energy prices. Unless directed otherwise by a Governmental Authority, the Operator shall curtail each Project pari passu in accordance with each Party s Percentage Interest; provided, however, in the event the need for the interruption or reduction can be attributed to a particular Party s Project or portions of its Project, then the Operator shall, to the extent possible, limit such interruption or reduction to such Project. Sharing of O&M Costs. Beginning upon the Broken Bow II Connection Date and continuing through the Term of this Agreement, each Party will be responsible for and will reimburse the Operator for its pro rata share (in proportion to the Parties respective Percentage Interests) of the O&M Costs during the Term. The Operator may select the billing period for the Parties payment of such O&M Costs (monthly, quarterly or yearly). At the Operator s option, the Operator may invoice the Parties for their estimated share of O&M Costs monthly or quarterly, with a yearly true-up thereafter. All such invoices shall be due and payable within thirty (30) days following receipt. The provisions of this Section 4.3 shall survive the termination of this Agreement. Replacement Operator. An Operator Default shall occur if: The Operator materially breaches Section 4.2 of this Agreement and the Operator fails to cure any such breach or action within thirty (30) days after receiving notice thereof (or, if such cure cannot reasonably be completed within the thirty (30)-day period, the Operator fails to undertake and promptly cure upon receipt of such notice or fails to give adequate assurances to the Parties that such breach or action will be so cured with all reasonable speed, not to exceed an additional thirty (30) days); the Operator dissolves, liquidates, or terminates its company existence, voluntarily or involuntarily; or following receipt of a proper dispatch instruction, the Operator fails to operate the Common Interconnection Facilities for a period in excess of twenty-four (24) hours. Upon the occurrence and continuation of an Operator Default, either Party shall be entitled, but shall not be obligated, to provide a written notice to the other Party and all Project Lenders initiating the following replacement procedures (an Operator Replacement Notice ). Upon delivery of the Operator Replacement Notice, the Parties shall meet at a time and place acceptable to the Parties to select a replacement operator for the Common Interconnection Facilities; provided, however, any such replacement operator, or its affiliates, cumulatively shall (i) have no less than five (5) years of current experience in operating and maintaining wind energy generation projects located in the United States and (ii) currently be engaged as the operation and maintenance provider, whether through affiliate arrangements or under contract to third parties, for no less than 500MW of wind energy generation projects located in the United States (the Replacement Operator ). The Parties shall use commercially reasonable efforts to select a Replacement Operator within fourteen (14) business days of such meeting. Upon selection of the Replacement Operator, the Parties and the Replacement Operator shall enter into an operations and maintenance agreement setting forth the rights and obligations of the Parties and the Replacement Operator with respect to the and maintenance of the Common Interconnection Facilities and Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area, which agreement shall be in a form and substance reasonably satisfactory to both Parties. USE OF COMMON INTERCONNECTION FACILITIES. Use. Subject to the other requirements of this Agreement, each Party shall have the right to use the Common Interconnection Facilities to the extent of such Party s Percentage Interest, including, to the extent applicable, the capacity of the Common Interconnection Facilities to transmit electricity bi-directionally from and to such Party s Project. The Parties acknowledge that use, access and capacity shall be shared pari passu in accordance with each Party s Percentage Interest. No Party shall use the Common Interconnection Facilities in connection with any projects other than its respective Project. No Waste or Nuisance; Non-Interference. No Party shall use or permit the use of the Common Interconnection Facilities in any manner that would create waste or nuisance, or that would increase the rate, or jeopardize the issuance or maintenance, of any insurance policy relating to the Common Interconnection Facilities or otherwise damage or interfere with, the Common Interconnection Facilities. Each Party shall at all times while conducting its respective operations and activities with respect to its respective Project make reasonable efforts to minimize the impact of such operations and activities upon the other Party s use of the Common Interconnection Facilities. No Public Access. The Parties agree that, unless so ordered by a Governmental Authority, there will be no general public access to the Common Interconnection Facilities. The Parties shall cooperate in enforcing such requirement for limiting access to the Common Interconnection Facilities, including establishing and enforcing procedures for security. Liens. Other than liens on the Undivided Interests of a Party granted to such Party s Project Lenders in connection with a Financing, no Party shall create, permit or suffer to exist by, through or under such Party and hereby waives for itself any liens on the Common Interconnection Facilities, or on the Undivided Interests of any other Party, including (a) liens for taxes, unless such liens are for taxes that are not yet delinquent or which are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, and (b) liens in favor of carriers , warehouseman s, mechanics , materialmen s, repairmen s or other like liens, unless such liens arise in the ordinary course of business of such Party and for amounts that are not yet due or which are being contested in good faith by appropriate proceedings, provided, in the case of any such lien permitted under clauses (a) and (b) above, so long as any such proceeding does not involve any substantial danger of the sale, forfeiture or loss of any part of the Common Interconnection Facilities and such Party posts any bond that is required by applicable Law to avoid such sale, forfeiture or loss while such claims are being contested. Any applicable Party shall take prompt steps to discharge any unpermitted lien filed against the Common Interconnection Facilities or Undivided Interest of any other Party and shall cause the applicable holder of such unpermitted lien to execute any release, reconveyance or other documentation reasonably requested by any other Party in order to evidence the release, removal or discharge of such unpermitted lien. If the Party fails to discharge promptly any such unpermitted lien, the other Party will have the right to notify the non-discharging Party in writing and to take any reasonable action to satisfy, defend, settle or otherwise remove the lien at the non-discharging Party s expense. For the avoidance of doubt, as of the Broken Bow II Connection Date, Broken Bow shall have discharged any and all liens of its Project Lenders in respect of the Undivided Interest transferred to Broken Bow II pursuant to Section 2.1 and shall cause such Project Lenders to execute a release and reconveyance in the form of Partial Deed of Reconveyance attached hereto as Exhibit F in order to evidence the release, removal and discharge of such liens. Standard of Performance. Notwithstanding any other provision of this Agreement to the contrary, each Party shall operate and maintain its Project and perform its obligations under this Agreement in accordance with all applicable Laws and Prudent Wind Industry Practices. Interconnection. Each Party shall be solely responsible for securing for its own benefit, and for maintaining, such rights as are necessary to interconnect its Project with the transmission and interconnection system through the Common Interconnection Facilities and to deliver the electrical energy generated by its Project, or such portion of the electrical energy generated by its Project, as is consistent with the terms and conditions of this Agreement, to the applicable point of interconnection. Regulatory Status. No Party shall take any action that could adversely impact (a) any Party s ability to qualify as an exempt wholesale generator, as such term is defined in Section 1262(6) of the Public Utility Holding Company Act of 2005 and the FERC s rules at 18 C.F.R. Part 366 (2006) or (b) any Party s authorization by FERC to sell electric energy, capacity and ancillary services at market-based rates, and approval by FERC of such regulatory waivers and blanket authorizations as are customarily granted by FERC to Persons with market-based rate authority, including blanket authorization to issue securities and assume liabilities pursuant to Section 204 of the FPA, with respect to the ownership and operation of such Party s Project. Neither Party shall take any action that could adversely impact the status of the other Party s Project as a qualifying small power production facility, as such term is defined in Section 3(17)(C) of the FPA, and the FERC s rules at 18 C.F.R. Part 292.203(a). Liabilities for the Account of the Parties; No Charging of Fees, Premiums or Profits. Except as specifically set forth in this Agreement, each Party shall be solely responsible for its liabilities relating to its Project and the operation and maintenance of its Project. Each Party shall, at its sole cost and expense, maintain in good working order and repair at all times each part of its Project that connects with or may affect the Common Interconnection Facilities. Further, each Party shall be responsible for all liabilities arising from such Party s actions or inactions in violation of this Agreement. The Parties agree that the purpose of this Agreement is for the Parties and their respective Project to benefit from the cost savings, convenience and efficiencies that result from the sharing of the Common Interconnection Facilities, and no Party shall charge any other Party any fee, premium, mark-up or other profit relating to the Common Interconnection Facilities or services provided under this Agreement, unless such Party or its affiliate is acting in the role of the Operator hereunder, in which case, any mark-up charged by such Party or its affiliate as an O&M Cost shall not exceed fifteen percent (15%). This Section shall not be construed as prohibiting in any way each Party s obligations to pay (a) O&M Costs, (b) any other costs and expenses incurred in connection with the sharing of the Common Interconnection Facilities or the providing of any services as provided in this Agreement or (c) any other amount required to be paid by a Party pursuant to this Agreement, including, but not limited to, the indemnification by a Party for Losses suffered by another Party hereunder. TERM. The term ( Term ) of this Agreement shall commence on the date hereof and shall continue in effect until the first to occur of (a) mutual written agreement of the Parties to terminate this Agreement, (b) the date on which both the Broken Bow Project and the Broken Bow II Project permanently cease production of electric energy, or (c) the date on which a Party becomes the owner of the entire ownership interest in all of the Common Interconnection Facilities, subject, in each case, to obtaining any necessary prior FERC approvals for termination. Broken Bow shall be responsible for funding and performing any required decommissioning work required by law, and all costs thereof that relate to the Common Interconnection Facilities shall constitute O&M Costs. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES Each of the Parties hereby represents and warrants to the other as follows: Organization. Such Party (a) is a limited liability company, duly organized and validly existing under the laws of its jurisdictions of formation, (b) has all requisite power and authority to own its assets, carry out its respective businesses and to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under this Agreement, and (c) is duly qualified to do business in, and is in good standing in all jurisdictions where the ownership of its respective properties or character of its respective businesses requires such qualification. Power and Authority. Such Party has the requisite power and authority to (a) execute on behalf of itself and each Person on whose behalf such Party has undertaken obligations by the terms of this Agreement, (b) deliver this Agreement and (c) perform fully their obligations hereunder. Such Party has taken all necessary action to authorize the execution and delivery of this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated hereby. Binding Nature. This Agreement has been duly executed and delivered by such Party and constitutes the legal, valid and binding obligation of such Party, enforceable against it (and as applicable each Person on whose behalf obligations are undertaken by the terms of this Agreement) in accordance with their respective terms, except as enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, fraudulent conveyance or transfer, moratorium or similar laws affecting the enforcement of creditors rights generally or by general principles of equity relating to enforceability (regardless of whether considered in a proceeding at law or in equity). No Conflicts. The execution and delivery of, and performance of such Party s obligations under, this Agreement does not and will not (a) violate or constitute a default under any indenture, mortgage, deed of trust, instrument or other contract to which such Party is a party or by which such Party or its assets may be bound; (b) violate any provisions of any law, rule, regulation, order, judgment or decree applicable to such Party or its assets; or (c) result in the creation of any lien on any of the assets owned or held by such Party. No Litigation. There are no actions, suits or proceedings pending or to such Party s knowledge, threatened against, involving or relating to, such Party or any of its respective properties or assets (including the Broken Bow Substation, the Broken Bow Project, the Broken Bow II Interconnection Facilities and/or Broken Bow II Project) which might materially impact such Party s ability to perform under this Agreement. No Shared Revenue Meter. Each of Broken Bow Project and Broken Bow II Project will have its own separate revenue meter, and there will be no revenue meter shared between the Projects. REGULATORY ACCEPTANCE, CHANGE IN LAW. FERC Acceptance. The Parties acknowledge that this Agreement must be accepted by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission ( FERC ) pursuant to Section 205 of the Federal Power Act or its successor ( FPA ) prior to service commencing on the Common Interconnection Facilities. The Parties agree to amend this Agreement as may be necessary for FERC acceptance, and the Parties shall jointly submit this Agreement for FERC acceptance promptly after the Effective Date. Regulatory Amendment. In the event that a change in the ownership of Broken Bow II and/or Broken Bow, or a change in the laws or regulations applicable to the Broken Bow II Project, the Broken Bow Project, Broken Bow II, Broken Bow or this Agreement, requires an amendment, modification or replacement of this Agreement in order to satisfy any applicable Law, the Parties agree to use good faith efforts to negotiate and implement mutually agreeable terms to accomplish such amendment, modification or replacement. If the Parties are unable to reach such agreement on the terms and conditions that would amend, modify or replace this Agreement, then either Party may file an unexecuted agreement with FERC pursuant to Section 205 of the FPA, and both Parties reserve all rights under the FPA. Common Interconnection Facilities. The Parties represent and acknowledge that, on the Broken Bow II Connection Date, the Common Interconnection Facilities have a value, as such term is defined in 18 C.F.R. 33.1(b)(3) of not more than Ten Million Dollars ($10,000,000). DISPUTE RESOLUTION Interest on Overdue Amounts. In the event of non-payment of amounts when due hereunder, in addition to any other rights and remedies provided under this Agreement or by law, the overdue amounts shall bear interest at a per annum rate of interest equal to two percent (2%) over the prime lending rate as published from time to time in The Wall Street Journal under Money Rates on the due date (or if not published on such date, on the most recent preceding day on which published) (the Interest Rate ), but in no event shall the Interest Rate exceed the maximum lawful rate. Disputed Invoices. In the event that a Party disputes the accuracy of any invoice, the disputing Party nevertheless shall pay the undisputed portion of the net amount of such invoice and shall notify the other Party of the specific basis for the dispute, including all supporting calculations, as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the basis for the dispute. Each Party shall be entitled to audit the invoicing Party s calculations with respect to any invoice in dispute at any time, during regular business hours on reasonable prior notice to the invoicing Party, at the sole cost of the requesting Party. Any disputed amount ultimately determined to be due (and any overpayment) shall bear interest at the Interest Rate from the date such amount was required to have been made due until paid (or from the date of payment until the date of refund in the case of overpayments). Management Intervention. In the event that the Parties are unable to reach agreement regarding disputed invoices or any other matter in question hereunder, within ten (10) calendar days after the written request of either Party, management representatives of the Parties with direct authority to enter into a settlement agreement shall meet and make a good faith effort to resolve the matter in question. Final Resolution. In the event the Parties management representatives are unable to achieve a resolution, then the disputed matter may be referred to litigation in any court of competent jurisdiction. Completion of the management settlement conference procedure set out in Section 9.3 shall be a condition precedent to initiating litigation. The prevailing Party in any such litigation shall be entitled to recover from the other Party its reasonable attorneys fees incurred in connection therewith. Premature Termination. Neither Party shall be permitted to terminate this Agreement for breach. MISCELLANEOUS. Specific Performance. Each Party hereby acknowledges that such Party s performance of its obligations under this Agreement is essential to the operation of the other Party s Project and that damages would be insufficient to compensate the other Party for any breach of this Agreement by such Party. Accordingly, in the event of any such breach or imminently threatened breach of this Agreement, in addition to any other rights and remedies available under this Agreement, at law or in equity, the non-breaching Party shall have the right to specific performance hereof without bond. Agreement to Cooperate; Further Assurances. Each Party agrees to reasonably cooperate with the other Party so that, subject to the terms of this Agreement, each of the Broken Bow Project and the Broken Bow II Project benefits from the full utilization and enjoyment of the Common Interconnection Facilities and the Ancillary Equipment as is necessary for the efficient operation of each such wind energy project. The Parties shall at all times hereafter execute and deliver any documents and do any further acts that may be necessary or desirable to carry out the purposes of this Agreement. Relationship of Parties. The Parties do not hereby intend to create any joint venture, partnership, association or any other entity for the conduct of any business. Nothing herein shall be deemed to authorize either Party to act on behalf of the other Party. Modification and Amendment. The terms of this Agreement may only be modified or amended in a writing signed by the Party or Parties to be bound thereby and, if necessary, accepted or approved by FERC, as applicable. Waiver. The failure of a Party to insist upon or enforce strict performance of any of the provisions of this Agreement or to exercise any rights or remedies under this Agreement shall not be construed as a waiver or relinquishment to any extent of such Party s right to assert or rely upon any such provisions, rights, and remedies in that or any other instance; rather, the same shall be and remain in full force and effect. Enforceability. Any provision of this Agreement which is prohibited or unenforceable in any jurisdiction shall, as to such jurisdiction, be ineffective only to the extent of such prohibition, but shall be effective to the extent of such remaining provisions hereof. Memorandum. Within ten (10) days following the date hereof, the Parties shall prepare, execute, have notarized, and record in the real property records of Custer County, Nebraska, a memorandum of this Agreement with sufficient specificity to satisfy applicable Nebraska legal requirements. Assignment. Upon notice to but without the need for the consent of the other Party, each Party may (i) collaterally assign this Agreement to any lenders or equity investors ( Project Lenders ) providing funding, financing, refinancing or credit support to that Party or any of its affiliates or subsidiaries or their wind energy facilities (a Financing ), or (ii) assign this Agreement to any of its affiliates or any successor owner of all or substantially all of the assets of the Broken Bow Project or the Broken Bow II Project, as applicable, provided that, in the case of clause (ii), such successor assumes (by operation of law or instrument satisfactory to the other Party) all of the assignor s obligations hereunder. Except for the foregoing or as otherwise permitted by this Agreement, neither Party may assign its rights or delegate its obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other Party. In connection with any Financing, the other Party agrees to provide the Project Lender(s) with a consent to the collateral assignment of this Agreement, legal opinions and other certificates and documents that are customary and reasonable, as and when reasonably requested by the Party undertaking the Financing. Any assignment of this Agreement shall be subject to obtaining required regulatory approvals or acceptances. The Common Interconnection Facilities Easement granted to Broken Bow II hereunder shall run with the land. Any sale, exchange, pledge, mortgage or other transfer of the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement Area shall be made expressly subject to the Common Interconnection Facilities Easement. Successors and Assigns. This Agreement will be binding on, and inure to the benefit of, the Parties and their successors and permitted assigns. The Common Interconnection Facilities will be held, conveyed, assigned, hypothecated, encumbered, leased, used and occupied, subject to the covenants, terms and provisions set forth in this Agreement and will be binding upon and inure to the benefit of each Party and each other Person having any interest therein during their ownership thereof, and their respective permitted grantees, heirs, successors and assigns, and will create privity of contract among the Parties and their respective grantees, heirs, successors and assigns. Governing Law; Waiver of Jury Trial. This Agreement shall be governed by and constructed in accordance with the laws of the State of Nebraska, without regard to its conflict of laws provisions. IN ADDITION, EACH PARTY HEREBY WAIVES, TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ANY RIGHT IT MAY HAVE TO A TRIAL BY JURY IN RESPECT OF ANY LITIGATION DIRECTLY OR INDIRECTLY ARISING OUT OF, UNDER OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT. Section Headings. The section headings in this Agreement are for convenience of reference only and shall not modify, define, expand, or limit any of the terms or provisions hereof. Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which when so executed shall be deemed an original, and all of which when taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument. Waiver of Partition. The Parties shall not have and hereby waive the right to partition all or any portion of the Common Interconnection Facilities, or to make application to any court or authority or to commence or prosecute any action or proceeding for partition of the Common Interconnection Facilities. Each Party shall be entitled to a decree or order restraining or enjoining such partition, application, action or proceeding upon any breach of the provisions of this Section 10.13. The Parties acknowledge and agree that they have been paid full consideration for the waiver provided in this Section 10.13. Limitation of Liability. SUBJECT TO SECTION 3.6(C), IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE, WHETHER AS A RESULT OF BREACH OF CONTRACT, INDEMNIFICATION, TORT LIABILITY (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE OR STRICT LIABILITY), OR OTHERWISE, TO ANY OTHER PARTY FOR (A) PUNITIVE DAMAGES OR (B) INDIRECT OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT THE EXCLUSIONS SET FORTH IN CLAUSES (A) AND (B) SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO LIMIT THE RECOVERY OF ANY DAMAGES THAT ARE INCLUDED IN THE AMOUNTS PAYABLE UNDER THE INDEMNIFICATION PROVISIONS SET FORTH IN THIS AGREEMENT FOR CLAIMS OF THIRD PARTIES, AND THE RESTRICTIONS SET FORTH IN CLAUSE (B) SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED TO LIMIT THE RECOVERY OF DIRECT OR REASONABLY FORESEEABLE DAMAGES. Notices. All notices and other communications given or made pursuant hereto shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given or made as of the date delivered, mailed or transmitted, and shall be effective (a) upon receipt if delivered personally, (b) three (3) business days after mailing by registered or certified mail (postage prepaid, return receipt requested), or (c) sent by electronic transmission to the facsimile number (with printed confirmation of receipt) specified below, to the parties at the following addresses (or at such other address for a party as shall be specified by like notice): If to Broken Bow: Broken Bow Wind, LLC c/o Edison Mission Wind, Inc. 3 MacArthur Place, Suite 100 Santa Ana, CA 92707 Attention: General Counsel Fax: (312) 788-5286 If to Broken Bow II: Broken Bow Wind II, LLC c/o BP Wind Energy North America Inc. Attention: Asset Manager 700 Louisiana, 33rd Floor Houston, TX 77002 Fax: (713) 354-2120 With a copy to: Project Counsel, at the same address If to Broken Bow Administrative Agent: KeyBank National Association 127 Public Square OH-01-27-0630 Cleveland, OH, 44114-1306 Attention: Keven D.
